name: epitaxial

relating to the growth of a thin crystal (= any solid consisting of atoms or molecules that are arranged in a regular structure) on top of another crystal, with both having a similar shape and structure: epitaxial growth Any suitable material that allows epitaxial growth can be used as a substrate.epitaxial layer The substrate includes an epitaxial layer where the memory cells of the computer are located. The atomic structure of these crystals is epitaxial in many cases. Related word
epitaxy
More examplesFewer examplesThe properties of epitaxial film growth are understood from experimental observations.The process involves depositing a metallic layer on the surface of the epitaxial layer.
